Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goose (head, neck and tail feathers missing) to right; part of rosette as filling ornament; below, two brown lines above guilloche band.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 241, no. 229, pl. 18. no. 229)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0224) (phase 2)
